headline.main: One Month Into the Afghan War

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''A Month in a Difficult Battlefield: Assessing U.S. War Strategy'' (front page, Nov. 8) highlights how wishful thinking took precedence over clear thinking. The United States began dropping bombs on Afghanistan in hopes that this attack, along with pinprick commando raids, would force the collapse of the Taliban. But it has become clear from Pentagon news conferences that the United States does not know how to fight this enemy or what it takes to win. If our leaders ran a company, they would have been fired for rolling out a policy that was poorly formulated and very unlikely to succeed.
abstract: Victor Parker letter comments on November 8 article on US military strategy in war against terrorism in Afghanistan
